author: norswap
content:
Stack: Yes that's a correct assessment.
TCP just lets you transport a "byte stream"
From what I gather here https://github.com/ethereum/devp2p/blob/master/rlpx.md, RLPx adds encryption, a packet format, and "capabilities" which seems to a scheme for versioning the protocol and adding extensions to it (such that if both nodes support the same capability, they can do extra fancy stuff). Unclear from skimming the spec if there are any standardized capabilities besides "p2p" which seems is always required.

author: norswap
content: Probably looking at implementations is your best bet
